A bit of context first. I've been playing Overwatch since 2018. It used to be one of my favourite games (Certainly my favourite multiplayer game). I loved the characters. I loved the lore. I loved the game. Sure there were issues even back then but the team behind the game was dedicated and tried hard to make the game worth paying for and worth playing.

I stopped playing regularly when the Overwatch team decided to abandon the game and focus solely on Overwatch 2, the "sequel".

When Overwatch "2" dropped, all the players of Overwatch 1 lost access to the game. A game that we had paid for was confiscated from us and we were forced to move to OW2 whether we wanted to or not. This was after we had been promised that OW2 was a PVE-focused update and that OW1 would remain as is while being supported simultaneously with OW2. WE WERE PROMISED THAT OW1 WOULD BE UN-TOUCHED AND WE WERE LIED TO.

Since then, it's been shitshow after shitshow. Overwatch 2 isn't a real sequel. They didn't add anything of value, in fact they removed stuff that was already present. (On-Fire System, the End-Game Cards, Browsing for players, removing a player from each side, etc). 

Overwatch 2 was a monetization update. They removed the lootbox system and added a cash shop and a battle pass. Suddenly, the skins that you could earn for free in OW1 cost $20 a piece in OW2. These are character specific non-transferable skins meaning that if you want to play more that 1 hero, you gotta fork the cash. An in-game weapons charm costs more than a real-life version sold by Blizzard themselves.

The heroes that used to given to everyone for free when they dropped in OW1 are now locked behind the battle pass. Hero-switching and countering is a core mechanic of the game, meaning that if you or a teammate doesn't have the latest hero, you are at an inherent disadvantage. OW2 is pay-to-win, in a sense.

Which brings us to Invasion and the PVE. Back in when they stopped supporting OW1, Blizzard announced that they were working on a sequel that would focus on PVE, something akin to Left for Dead. Left for Dead's gameplay and Overwatch's world and lore. Needless to say, we were excited. A few months ago, Blizzard revealed that PVE, the only reason why we tolerated the abandoning of OW1, had been cancelled a year. Blizzard already knew they weren't going to have PVE in OW2 but used it's hype to push their shitty microtransaction update.

These Invasion missions are a joke. They are not worth your time. Do not buy them. Do not support Activision-Blizzard. They have proven time and time again that you as a player mean nothing to them. Your time, your money, your passion, your love means nothing against a few more dollars. Instead of Blizzard, please go support better devs. Value yourself because Blizzard certainly doesn't.

It has to be an achievement to turn something that I loved for so many years into something that I hope crashes and burns. The move to Steam is a desperate attempt at replenishing the floundering playerbase. I hope Overwatch 2 is immortalised as a warning and a reminder to other companies that unchecked greed has consequences.

This game went to hell real fast. OW1 was really cool and intuitive and I think showed the aspirations and goals of what this game could've been. It had a ton of updates, interesting heroes to choose from, a lot of lore and varied events that you could play. On top of it all, you could boot up the game and play one match and get a loot box - with a chance to get a legendary just for playing one game every day. It was tons of fun to play with friends, do exciting team synergies with tank combos, ultimate combos, all that, and the competitive scene was super exciting to watch, especially the esports events!!!

Anyway OW2 isn't any of that.

First of all, they made it free to play so that they could justify making one legendary skin cost 10+ dollars PER. But its not all bad right? Surely you can earn credits in game- Nope! You get a certain amount of LEGACY CREDITS for free from the Battlepass, but to get NORMAL CREDITS you have to either buy them, or complete weekly challenges. Lets say you wanted a Legendary Skin that costs a measly 1000 normal credits, compared to the event skins that cost 1500+. That still takes 16 weeks+ of grinding to get one legendary skin, and thats just a COMMON legendary skin, given that you're completing the weekly challenges every week that are sometimes very daunting to actually do. 

Compare that to how in OW1 you could just get a legendary skin by loading up the game, playing one match and winning. Sure, loot boxes weren't crazy good, but you could just choose to not indulge in buying them and just play the game or complete events. If you choose not to indulge in the new predatory shop system, good luck grinding for months just for one skin.

The battlepass is also stupid. Namely - locking new heroes behind a PAYWALL. This game is ENTIRELY focused around switching team compositions to counter the enemies. Like a Ramattra against a Reinhardt, a Soldier against a Pharah. Now, you can't do that. You can't actively change characters like the game is intended.

This is stupid. REALLY STUPID. Because why would you design a game like this only to double back and force people to pay to be able to just play the game normally like we've been doing for years?!?! New characters tend to be pretty strong, so people that buy the battle pass are just naturally at an advantage for weeks until people grind enough to get halfway through the entire battle pass. Ridiculous game design and business practice. People will wait months to buy skins for the new characters because they won't have them yet, so what is the goal here? Lure people into paying for the battle pass? New idea; MAKE THEM ACTUALLY WORTH THE PRICE!!! Or just put a price tag on the actual game and give content for free because of that justifying the price tag - LIKE OVERWATCH 1. How do you manage to downgrade??? Its meant to be OVERWATCH 2 and yet there were so many missing features in the game.

OW2 is just a money-hungry sponge being squeezed for any penny it can get before it inevitably crumbles because the company handling it just cannot get their shit together. If you wanted money, MAKE THE GAME WORTH THE MONEY! JUST MAKE AN ENJOYABLE EXPERIENCE! Look at top titles and then look at OW2. How embarrassing.

OW2 also took away a million features from OW1. It removed an entire gamemode and then added a new one that can take upwards of 10+ minutes simply because of how it is designed. Push mode also makes you spend half of the match walking to the fight only to instantly die and usually always in the same three areas because of how you have to spend all that time GETTING to the objective.

I would SO MUCH prefer just getting loot boxes back. I think everyone can agree that they'd prefer the random chance to get cosmetics rather than having to grind for SO LONG just to get something that would've taken one match before. Also stop locking heroes behind a paywall or stop adding them. You can't balance a game where most of the characters required for countering other heroes aren't available to people. Its predatory, scummy and shows that this game's team does NOT care for the community. 

To be fair though, the dev team making the game aren't entirely to blame I feel, considering that they are just doing what they're told by the higher ups that just see this game as a cash cow rather than an enjoyed experience by a dedicated community.

It feels like such a waste to have such cool characters in OW2, everything but the game is good. The story, the designs, the concepts. Then you get to the game and theres the same two team compositions that are strong and no other characters are viable until they update the game ONCE EVERY LIKE FEW MONTHS!!!! You cannot make a live service PvP game and take MONTHS to update it. It requires active balancing and they just don't care to do it.

PvE. This was coming inevitably. OW2 shouldn't exist. There should still be duo tanks, there should still be 2CP, there should still be so much better quality content that was left in OW1. Because PvE justified it - a mode that allows you to explore the diverse creative world of Overwatch, learn more about characters and where they come from and create interesting ability builds and team compositions with your friends! Hours of infinitely replayable content with a group of friends all for free, coming with the game's launch!

Wrong. PvE was scrapped a year before release and yet was advertised as a main selling point of OW2 up until they had enough people hooked to where they could announce its cancellation without a huge financial loss. But wait - we're still getting PvE! In really short missions that can be completed super quickly with zero replayability in the style of old missions we've already played through since OW1. What's more - now you have to buy them to play them! Lucky us, right? OW2 team really giving us the experience we've desired for so long.

Just. This is all from the perspective of a dedicated player who loves this game despite all of this. Don't get it. Don't get into it. Do not make purchases on the shop, don't buy the battlepasses. It isn't worth it. Spend it on a game that actually rewards you for giving a fuck about it and appreciates you as a player.

I love Overwatch, maybe it'll make a comeback, but I really don't see it. When they slapped a 2 next to the title, the game just started rolling downhill and instead of hitting a plateau or a bottom, it falls into a burning pit where its slowly decaying, trying its best to stay in one piece but ultimately a fraction of its former self.
